rw.ExGUtils package¶

Submodules¶

rw.ExGUtils.exgauss module¶

rw.ExGUtils.nummath module¶

rw.ExGUtils.nummath.fitter(func, xx, yy, p0, suc=False)¶

Fits the points in xx,yy according to func with parameters in p0. func = func(p, x)

rw.ExGUtils.nummath.integral(func, ini, fin, Nints=20)¶

Calculates the integral of func between ini and fin with 20 points gaussian method dividing the interval [ini; fin] in Nint intervals.

rw.ExGUtils.nummath.minsquare(X, Y, G=1)¶

Calculates the coefficients of the best polinomial to fil the points in X,Y list. G is the degree of the polinomial.

y=alpha[0]+alpha[1]*x+alpha[2]*x**2+…

rw.ExGUtils.nummath.zero(func, x0, eps=1e-09, delt=0.01)¶

Finds the zero of function func starting at x0 with precision eps. delt is the dx for calculation the derivative (func(x+delt)-func(x))/delt)

rw.ExGUtils.stats module¶

rw.ExGUtils.stats.ANOVA(tab)¶
ANOVA test for table tab (tab should be a list of lists).
Values returned are in order:
Fs: Value for the variable F (F of snedecor). glentre: degrees of freedom in between. gldentro: degrees of fredom inside. 1-fsnede: left tail (p-value for the test).
rw.ExGUtils.stats.histogram(lista, ini=None, fin=None, Nint=None, dell=0.5, accu=0)¶

Returns a list with the histigram of the elements in lista. ini is the lowest value, fin the highest and Nint the number of intervals in the histogram. dell is a shift for the values in the xxx list. accu=0 means histogram made with frequencies, accu=+-1 means accumulated

frequencies to the right or left.
rw.ExGUtils.stats.rand()¶

random() -> x in the interval [0, 1).

rw.ExGUtils.stats.rand_exg(mu, sig, tau)¶

Generates random number with ex-gaussian distribution.

rw.ExGUtils.stats.rand_exp(tau)¶

Generates random number with exponential distribution.

rw.ExGUtils.stats.stats(lista)¶

Calculates the average and dispersion of the values in lista.

rw.ExGUtils.stats.stats_int(xi, ni)¶
Calculates the average and dispersion of the values in intervals
(value xi[i] with absolute frequency ni[i]).
